Article Title: How Google, Zomato, Swiggy, Netflix, and others celebrated team India's homecoming after T20 World Cup win
Article Text: The last week has been all about the Indian Cricket team ’s victory in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024. Rohit Sharma-led Indian team defeated South Africa by 7 runs in the high-octane finale to win their second T20 world championship title. After being stuck on the Caribbean island for three days, the Indian team travelled back to India on Air India ’s charter AIC24WC, which became the most-tracked flight for more than 15 hours.Upon their return, the squad celebrated the victory with the fans in Mumbai. Fans apart, Indian brands also celebrated the victory in their own unique ways, rising to the occasion and applauding the achievement. Here are some of the posts from the internet.
Article Summary: Rohit Sharma-led Indian team defeated South Africa by 7 runs in the high-octane finale to win their second T20 world championship title. After being stuck on the Caribbean island for three days, the Indian team travelled back to India on Air India ’s charter AIC24WC.

Article Title: Twenty20 World Cup victory parade in Mumbai: 15 memes that broke the internet
Article Text: India's T20 World Cup-winning cricketers returned home with the cup on July 4 morning. The World Champions arrived in Delhi at 6am (IST) after a non-stop 16-hours journey in the Air India special charter flight AIC24WC -- Air India Champions 24 World Cup.The day started for the Indian cricket team with breakfast at the Prime Minister's residence and ended among a sea of fans who brought the 'Maximum City' to a standstill.The Rohit Sharma-led team started the open-top bus parade from Marine Drive. Fans turned up in huge numbers, danced to celebrate India's success and welcomed the arrival of the T20 World Cup-winning team. The euphoric homecoming resembled a giant street party.After the conclusion of the victory parade, the Indian team was felicitated at the Wankhede Stadium. After the Indian team arrived at the Wankhede Stadium , the T20 World Cup-winning players danced to the beats of dhol.Indian cricket fans have been celebrating their team's victory ever since they won the World Cup on June 29. It seems to be a dream that all cricket fans across the country are living. From Instagram to Facebook to X (formerly Twitter), all social media platforms are flooded with posts related to India's T20 World Cup win.Here are 15 memes of the Marine Drive victory parade that have broken the internetThe World Cup-winning players distributed balls to the fans who were present at the stadium. The collective performance saw India end their ICC World Cup trophy drought that lasted for 13 years and become the first team to win the T20 World Cup title unbeaten. "The huge turnout of fans to welcome us shows they were as desperate for this T20 World Cup title as we were," said an exhausted but elated Rohit Sharma at the end of the victory parade in Mumbai's iconic Wankhede Stadium, packed to capacity with fans who cheered their lungs out.
Article Summary: India's T20 World Cup-winning cricketers returned home with the cup on July 4 morning. The World Champions arrived in Delhi at 6am (IST) after a non-stop 16-hours journey in the Air India special charter flight AIC24WC. The euphoric homecoming resembled a giant street party.

Article Title: This Google app may get a feature for your besties
Article Text: Google Contacts is preparing to introduce a new feature called the " Besties Widget ," as revealed in the latest APK Insight update by 9to5Google. This follows the recent update to the Individual contact widget, which now displays notifications. The "Besties Widget" is expected to display starred contacts in a layout similar to the existing Favorite contacts widget.Google introduced the "Favorite contacts" widget last year, allowing users to display up to seven contacts. This widget provides quick access to full contact details and can be resized. The new "Besties Widget," as seen in version 4.35 of the app, is currently similar in layout to the Favorite widget, displaying starred contacts. It shares the same description and appears to replace the existing Favorite contacts widget.This development is still in progress, and the widget still needs to be fully functional. As the app-level widget development progresses, users might see more frequent updates compared to system-level widget updates.The shift to app-level development for widgets allows for more dynamic updates and improvements. This could lead to enhanced functionality and better user experience over time. The new "Besties Widget" may offer a more personalized way to stay connected with starred contacts, streamlining communication and access to important contacts.
Article Summary: The "Besties Widget" is expected to display starred contacts in a layout similar to the existing Favorite contacts widget. This follows the recent update to the Individual contact widget, which now displays notifications. The development is still in progress, and the widget still needs to be fully functional.

Article Title: Samsung may have a PC 'plan' to stop Exynos chips from overheating
Article Text:
What is this technology and how it will improve Exynos chips



Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Z Flip 6 to launch soon: What we know so far



Samsung may have a new cooling solution for the upcoming Exynos chipsets that power smartphones. According to a report by The Elec, the South Korean tech giant is working on a new chip packaging technology to stop Exynos chipsets from facing overheating issues.Named fan-out wafer-level package-HPB ( FOWLP-HPB ), this tech involves attaching a type of heatsink, called a heat path block (HPB), to the top of the chipset.The report claims that this heatsink technology is derived from PCs and servers, and is expected to be used on the upcoming Exynos processors .As per the report, the tech is only arriving on smartphones now due to its smaller form factor. The report also suggests that miniaturising the technology was also a challenge.Samsung is expected to complete the development of the tech by Q4 2024 which will open the door to mass production. This timeline suggests that the technology may first arrive on the Exynos 2500 chipsets.The report claims that some Galaxy S25 models which may come powered by the Exynos 2500 chipsets is likely to be equipped with this cooling tech provided that development wraps by Q4.Exynos chipsets, starting with the latest Exynos 2400 as well as the older ones faced some heating and throttling issues. So this packaging technology is expected to help Exynos chips to offer more consistent performance, better battery life and cooler phones.Samsung's upcoming foldable phones, the Z Fold 6 and Z Flip 6, will release at the next Glaaxy Unpacked event which is set to be held on July 10. Both phones are expected to boast a durability improvement with an IP48 dust and water resistance rating.The Z Fold 6 is likely to feature massive displays (7.6-inch main, 6.3-inch cover) with a 120Hz refresh rate. The Z Flip 6 may also get a battery bump to 4,000mAh addressing prior concerns.Both phones are expected to pack the powerful Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor and 12GB of RAM. For photography, the Z Flip 6's may also come with the upgraded 50MP main sensor.
Article Summary: Samsung may have a new cooling solution for the upcoming Exynos chipsets that power smartphones. The tech involves attaching a type of heatsink, called a heat path block (HPB), to the top of the chipset. The report claims that this heatsink technology is derived from PCs and servers, and is expected to be used on the upcoming exynos processors. It is only arriving on smartphones now due to its smaller form factor.

Article Title: Zomato suspends this ‘experimental’ delivery service, restarts another with ‘new’ condition
Article Text:
Zomato restarts “Legends” delivery

Why Zomato suspended “Legends” delivery

Zomato has suspended its hyperlocal goods delivery service ' Xtreme ', which it launched last year to compete with intracity small package delivery services providers Shadowfax, Porter and Loadshare. Separately, the Gurgaon-based company has relaunched its intercity food delivery offering ' Legends ' in a new avatar.Citing people aware of the matter, a report by The Economic Times said that the service is being discontinued on account of poor demand.“It was an experiment...a lot of restaurants do direct delivery and the company's feedback was that restaurants wanted a similar quality of experience for direct deliveries. That was the basis on which Xtreme was rolled out. But it was always an experiment and could have swung either way,” a company executive was quoted as saying.This service aimed to leverage Zomato's existing delivery network to provide intracity package deliveries across nearly all of the 750-800 cities where the company offers food delivery. However, it seems that it hasn't yielded the desired results. Zomato has also removed the dedicated Xtreme app from the Google Play Store.Zomato has reintroduced its "Legends" offering for intercity food delivery, albeit with a significant makeover.Zomato will deliver directly from renowned restaurants in select cities, however, the renewed focus on fresh deliveries will come at a cost. Zomato has introduced a minimum order value of Rs 5,000, potentially limiting its appeal to budget-conscious customers.The service is currently available in a few key cities like Delhi-NCR and Bengaluru, with plans for expansion in the near future, a person with knowledge of the matter told ET.In April this year, Zomato suspended intercity deliveries after it failed to generate much revenue for the company and traction among consumers, amid legal issues after a Delhi resident filed a case against it, challenging the company's promise of delivery from renowned restaurants in other cities.Zomato Legends was first launched in 2022 but last year, the company tweaked the model to deliver pre-stocked items from other cities with a shorter delivery timeline.
Article Summary: Zomato has suspended its hyperlocal goods delivery service'Xtreme ', which it launched last year to compete with intracity small package delivery services providers Shadowfax, Porter and Loadshare. Separately, the Gurgaon-based company has relaunched its intercity food delivery offering'Legends'in a new avatar.

Article Title: Google plans to export made in India Pixel phones to Europe and US
Article Text: Google is set to make India a key export hub for its Pixel smartphones, with plans to ship devices to Europe and the United States, MoneyControl reports. The tech giant will begin commercial production through partnerships with Foxconn and Dixon Technologies ' subsidiary, Padget Electronics.Trial production has already started in Tamil Nadu with Foxconn, which also assembles iPhones in India."Google is a large brand, which Dixon will add to its customer list in the second half of the year through its partnership with Compal. They will share the production with Foxconn," a source revealed to MoneyControl.The production strategy involves Dixon Technologies manufacturing the base variant of Pixel phones, while Foxconn will handle the Pro variants. Commercial production is expected to commence in September, with exports following once production stabilises."Google will make a formal announcement in H2... they are committed to India. The initial plan is to serve Europe and going forward Google will address demand in the US with India-made Pixel smartphones," the source added.This move aligns with the government's production-linked incentive (PLI) program, aimed at boosting domestic manufacturing. "Since demand for Pixel smartphones is very low in India, Google plans to export most of the locally produced devices from Foxconn and Dixon facilities leveraging the PLI benefits," another source explained.Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin recently confirmed the partnership, stating, "As a result of the negotiations, Google will partner with Foxconn in Tamil Nadu to produce the Pixel cellphones and has offered to set up a factory."Google announced its plan to make Pixel phones in India in October 2023, starting with Pixel 8 and 8 Pro.
Article Summary: Google is set to make India a key export hub for its Pixel smartphones. The tech giant will begin commercial production through partnerships with Foxconn and Dixon Technologies'subsidiary, Padget Electronics. Commercial production is expected to commence in September, with exports following once production stabilises.

Article Title: Apple MacBook models with M4 chipsets may come with ‘paid’ AI features
Article Text:
Apple MacBook models with M4 chipset: Expected availability



Apple MacBook Pro models with M4 chipsets: What to expect



Apple is expected to launch new MacBook Pro and MacBook Air models in the coming months. According to a report by Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman, the rumoured MacBook Pro and MacBook Air machines are likely to come powered by three variants of Apple’s M4 chipsets -- the base M4, M4 Pro and M4 Max chipsets. The report also notes that the upgraded MacBooks may retain their predecessor's designs and may even offer new features through an AI subscription service which is expected to boost sales.Rumours suggest that Apple will soon release 14-inch and 16-inch models of MacBook Pros with M4 chips by the end of this year or early next year. Moreover, MacBook Air sizes are also in line for an early 2025 refresh.Currently, the only Apple devices with the M4 chip are the newest iPad Pro models . The most affordable option is the 11-inch iPad Pro with 256GB of storage which was launched at Rs 99,900.Gurman claims that both the MacBook Pro and MacBook Air won't see any design changes despite getting upgraded to the M4 chipsets. This comes after the 2021 redesign of the MacBook Pro with the M1 chip.He also suggested that a more significant visual overhaul might be coming in 2026, potentially coinciding with the adoption of OLED displays similar to the latest iPad Pro models.Similarly, the MacBook Air is also expected to wait until 2027 for a design refresh, five years after it departs from the wedge shape.Gurman acknowledges that a chip upgrade alone might not be enough to entice existing MacBook users to upgrade.To address this, Apple is reportedly considering a monthly subscription service that builds upon the free Apple Intelligence launching this fall.Additionally, Gurman claims Apple might integrate and potentially take a commission on third-party AI services like ChatGPT, mirroring their App Store model.
Article Summary: Apple is expected to launch new MacBook Pro and MacBook Air models in the coming months. The rumoured machines are likely to come powered by three variants of Apple’s M4 chipsets. The upgraded MacBooks may retain their predecessor's designs and may even offer new features through an AI subscription service.

Article Title: Elon Musk responds to Chinese girl who wants him to fix a bug in Tesla screen: Watch
Article Text: A young Tesla owner in China, Molly, has shared a video message directly addressing Tesla CEO Elon Musk about a bug on her car's touchscreen.In a short video posted on X, Molly highlighted the issue she is facing with the touchscreen in her Tesla car. When she tries to draw on the touchscreen, previously drawn lines disappear as she adds new ones. With wide eyes and a clear explanation, she asks Mr.Musk to "fix an error" on her Tesla.The video quickly went viral on the X platform (formerly known as Twitter), garnering millions of views and capturing the attention of the Tesla CEO himself. Responding to the video, Musk simply replied "Sure," sparking further conversation online.Shared on X (formerly Twitter), the post quickly gained traction, garnering over a million views and 16,000 likes from users. Many users have also reacted to the video.Here are some of the reactions“this is a critical issue @elonmusk please fix it”“Oh please this is very concerning @elonmusk ! Help her”“halt all production until we resolve. please and thank you.”“Awww, she’s so adorable”
Article Summary: A young Tesla owner in China, Molly, shared a video message directly addressing Tesla CEO Elon Musk about a bug on her car's touchscreen. The video quickly went viral on the X platform (formerly known as Twitter), garnering millions of views and capturing the attention of the Tesla CEO himself.

Article Title: iQoo Z9 Lite 5G smartphone to launch in India on July 15: Here’s what the smartphone may offer
Article Text:
iQoo Z9 Lite confirmed details

iQoo Z9 Lite expected specs and price

iQoo is all set to launch its new Z-series smartphone in India. The Chinese smartphone maker iQoo has confirmed that it will launch the iQoo Z9 Lite smartphone in the country on July 15.The company posted on X (formerly known as Twitter) about the upcoming iQoo launch. “Taking it slow? - no more! A #FullyLoaded5G experience awaits you! #iQOOZ9Lite,” reads the post.Along with the launch date, iQoo has also shared a teaser image of the upcoming iQoo Z9 Lite smartphone.The company has confirmed that the yet-to-launch iQoo Z9 Lite smartphone will sport a dual rear camera setup. The smartphone will feature a flat rear panel and display. The dual rear camera is placed inside a rectangular module located at the top left corner.The smartphone maker has also confirmed that the iQoo Z9 Lite smartphone will pack an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with 6GB of RAM. The smartphone will offer 128GB internal storage.iQoo Z9 Lite is said to sport a 6.56-inch HD+ LCD display which is expected to offer up to 90Hz of refresh rate. The smartphone is tipped to sport a 50MP main camera and a 2MP depth sensor.The smartphone is also rumoured to come equipped with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor and house a 5000 mAh battery with 15W fast charging support.Multiple online rumours suggest that the iQoo Z9 Lite may come with a starting price tag of Rs 10,000.
Article Summary: iQoo is all set to launch its new Z-series smartphone in India. The Chinese smartphone maker has confirmed that it will launch the iQoo Z9 Lite smartphone in the country on July 15. The smartphone is tipped to sport a 50MP main camera and a 2MP depth sensor. It is also rumoured to come equipped with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor.

Article Title: Credit card cyber fraud: Essential steps to safeguard your finance
Article Text:
Best tips to protect from credit card cyber fraud

Monitor account activity: Regularly review your credit card statements and transaction history for any unauthorised charges or suspicious activity.

Enable alerts: Set up transaction alerts through your bank or credit card issuer to receive notifications of any transactions made with your card.

Use strong and unique passwords: Secure your online banking and shopping accounts with strong passwords that include a combination of letters, numbers, and special characters. Avoid using information that is easily guessed, such as birth dates and names.

Enable 2-factor authentication: Utilise two-factor authentication (2FA) wherever possible to add an extra layer of security to your online accounts.

Be cautious of phishing scams: Avoid clicking on links or downloading attachments from unsolicited emails, messages, or websites that ask for your credit card information.

Shop only on secure websites: Ensure that the websites you use for online shopping are secure. To ensure secure browsing, ensure that the URL contains HTTPS and a padlock symbol in the address bar.

Use virtual credit card numbers: Some banks offer virtual credit card numbers for online transactions. These are temporary numbers that cannot be linked to your actual credit card account.

Keep your devices secure: Install antivirus software, keep your operating system and apps updated, and avoid connecting to unsecured public Wi-Fi networks when making online transactions.

Shred personal documents: Shred any documents containing sensitive information such as credit card statements or receipts before disposing of them.

Report lost or stolen cards immediately: Contact your bank or credit card issuer immediately if your card is lost or stolen to prevent unauthorised use.

Also read

Credit card fraud involves cybercriminals obtaining sensitive credit card information such as the card number, PIN, CVV, and other necessary details to make unauthorised purchases or transfers.While credit card fraud detection systems can aid in identifying fraudulent transactions to some extent, fraudsters often manage to inflict substantial financial harm on victims before being apprehended.Therefore, it's crucial to familiarise oneself with various types of credit card fraud and take proactive measures to avoid becoming a victim. Being vigilant and informed can significantly reduce the risk of falling prey to such fraudulent activities.Despite the low or zero liabilities for credit card users, fraud or identity theft can still cause significant inconvenience for both customers and banks. While the bank's zero-liability policy protects credit card users from financial losses if they report the fraud within 60 days, they must endure the process of detecting the theft, notifying the bank, obtaining a replacement card, paying any associated fees, and updating all automatic payment accounts.The rise of awareness among credit card users is essential for early detection and prevention of fraud, helping banks address potential issues proactively.
Article Summary: The rise of awareness among credit card users is essential for early detection and prevention of fraud. Fraud or identity theft can still cause significant inconvenience for both customers and banks. Being vigilant and informed can significantly reduce the risk of falling prey to such fraudulent activities.

Article Title: Virat Kohli's this 'Jai Hind post' becomes the 'most-liked' ever on Instagram
Article Text:
Virat Kohli’s Instagram post

Virat Kohli announced retirement from T20 playing format

Virat Kohli has smashed another record, this time off the field. His celebratory Instagram post following India's T20 World Cup victory has become the most-liked photo ever posted on an Indian account.The emotional post, featuring a collage of Team India celebrating their win, garnered over 19 million likes and counting at the time of writing.Kohli's caption, simply stating "Couldn't have dreamt of a better day than this. God is great and I bow my head in gratitude. We finally did it 🇮🇳❤️🇮🇳❤️jai hind ❤️❤️❤️," resonated deeply with fans across the nation.The previous record for the most-liked Instagram post in India was held by Bollywood couple Kiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra 's wedding announcement. However, Virat Kohli's post surpassed that record with a significant margin.The comments section of his post was flooded with congratulatory messages from celebrities, athletes, and fans alike. Even international sports stars joined the celebration, with comments from MMA fighter Conor McGregor and Brazilian footballer Vinicius Jr. showering Kohli with praise.Virat Kohli announced his retirement from the T20 International format after leading his team to a thrilling victory in the 2024 T20 World Cup final. "This was my last T20 game playing for India," Kohli declared. "This World Cup was the perfect culmination for this chapter in my career. Time for the next generation to take the T20 game forward."
Article Summary: Virat Kohli has smashed another record, this time off the field. His celebratory Instagram post following India's T20 World Cup victory has become the most-liked photo ever posted on an Indian account. The emotional post, featuring a collage of Team India celebrating their win, garnered over 19 million likes.

Article Title: Airtel Hikes Tariffs: Airtel announces mobile tariff hike: Here's full list of new plans and prices
Article Text:
Following a recent adjustment, Bharti Airtel has increased the price of its monthly plan to Rs 199, offering 2GB data daily, unlimited calling, and 100 SMS per day. The annual plan now costs Rs 1,999 with the same benefits. These changes aim to support budget-constrained consumers while maintaining service quality.

Bharti Airtel has announced a price hike across all its prepaid and postpaid plans. Airtel's revised tariff plans will be effective from today, July 3. As announced by the company, it has increased the price of its entry-level plans by 70 paise, 'in order to eliminate any burden on budget challenged consumers.'It must be noted here that while the plans have become costlier, benefits like data, call minutes, etc remain the same.In total, Airtel has increased the price of 15 prepaid and postpaid plans. These prices apply to all circles, including Bharti Hexacom Ltd. Circles. Reliance Jio and Vodafone Idea have also increased their tariff rates by up to 22%.The revised tariff increases the price of Rs 179 monthly plan to Rs 199. The plan will continue to offer 2GB mobile data per day, unlimited calling and 100 SMS per day. Validity of the plan remains 28 days. Similarly, the annual plan of Rs 1,799 offering 2GB mobile data per day, unlimited calling and 100 SMSes every day will now cost Rs 1,999.Airtel's daily data add-on plans now come at Rs 22 onwards (a hike of Rs 3 from the previous Rs 19).Coming to Airtel's postpaid plans, the price now ranges from Rs 449 to Rs 1,199. Daily data plans offering up to 3GB data per day now come with starting price of Rs 265.
Article Summary: Bharti Airtel has increased the price of its monthly plan to Rs 199, offering 2GB data daily, unlimited calling, and 100 SMS per day. The annual plan now costs Rs 1,999 with the same benefits. These changes aim to support budget- constrained consumers while maintaining service quality.

Article Title: Why Anand Mahindra ‘called’ ChatGPT after India’s Cricket World Cup win
Article Text:
Why Anand Mahindra ‘called’ ChatGPT

“Hello Chat GPT 4.O

Please make me a graphic image showing the Indian Cricket team as Superheroes.

Because they were SuperCool till the end.

The greatest gift of this final to India was that it didn’t come easy. It almost slipped out of their grasp. But they never lost the match in their minds.

Reminding all of us that being a Superhero never comes without a fierce determination to win and a Never Give In attitude.

Jai Ho! #IndiavsSA #T20WorldCupFinal” reads the post.

Here how users reacted to the post

Team India becomes T20 World Cup 2024 champions

Mahindra Group chairman Anand Mahindra is known for his active social media presence and witty remarks. Following India's dominating victory against South Africa in the T20 World Cup final, Mahindra posted a congratulatory message on X (formerly known as Twitter) with the help of ChatGPT .Mahindra asked ChatGPT 4.0 to create an AI-generated image of the Indian Cricket Team, requesting that the cricketers be depicted as superheroes.Mahindra also shared the ChatGPT-generated image on X. In the image, Team India is depicted as superheroes wearing capes featuring the Indian national flag.Men in Blue secured a thrilling victory in the T20 World Cup 2024 final. After a tense battle against South Africa at the iconic Kensington Oval, India emerged champions with a narrow seven-run win. Virat Kohli's dominant 76 and Rohit Sharma 's sharp captaincy were instrumental in securing the win. Following the game, Virat Kohli also announced his retirement from the T20 format.
Article Summary: Anand Mahindra asked ChatGPT 4.0 to create an AI-generated image of the Indian Cricket Team. In the image, Team India is depicted as superheroes wearing capes featuring the Indian national flag. Men in Blue secured a thrilling victory in the T20 World Cup 2024 final.

Article Title: Shark Tank Judge Anupam Mittal on India semi-final win: Chalo 'yeh bhi' hisaab barabar
Article Text:
Here's what Anupam Mittal wrote on X

How other brands celebrated India's win

India reached the finals of ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 with a thumping victory over England by 68 runs. After losing the toss against England, India scored 171/7 in 20 overs at the Guyana National Stadium. The men in blue all out England in just 16.4 overs, limiting them to 103 runs. India will now play the finals against South Africa on June 29 at Barbados.Like other matches, India's victory over England is being celebrated across the country.Shark Tank judge Anupam Mittal shared his joy over India's win via a post on microblogging platform - X, formerly Twitter.In his post, Mittal wrote "1947 me India se nikala aur 2024 me West Indies se,". Adding further, he said "Chalo 🇬🇧2022 ka bhi hisaab barabar 🇮🇳🏆," pointing at 2022 India's loss against England in the 2022 T20 World Cup semi-final ."don't know about english tea, but english tears are delicious 😂 #INDvENG," food delivery app Zomato wrote in a X post."Just packing ; Revenge order for Semi-Final in 2022 😤," Walmart-owned Flipkart wrote. “Hitman has once again added hope to the cart 🙏," the e-commerce company wrote in another post on X.Quick commerce app Blinkit shared an image of billboard that read "Dear England, if you are thirsty, we can deliver a bo'ah of wo'ah in 10 minutes."
Article Summary: India reached the finals of ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 with a thumping victory over England by 68 runs. The men in blue all out England in just 16.4 overs, limiting them to 103 runs. India will now play the finals against South Africa on June 29 at Barbados.

Article Title: Microsoft Xbox server outage fixed, here’s what the company said
Article Text:
What caused the Xbox outage?

Microsoft has fixed the Xbox Live service outage that impacted users worldwide who were unable to sign into their Xbox accounts. According to the official support page of Xbox, the service is now up and running.The outage, according to Downdetector, started late night on July 2 around 11pm IST and lasted for several hours till morning next day.Xbox started an investigation which lasted for hours.However, the company did not reveal the exact reason of what resulted in the outage, but kept continuously updating users about it.After the service was restored, official handle of Xbox Support on X (formerly Twitter) said “Users should no longer be encountering issues signing in to Xbox Live and services. Thank you for your patience, game on!”.As per Downdetector, thousands of Xbox Live users were affected by the outage. The company said that it was “aware that some users have been disconnected from Xbox Live. We're investigating! Please follow here and on our status page for updates. http://Xbox.com/status”.While the status page read “You may not be able to sign-in to your Xbox profile, may be disconnected while signed in, or have other related problems,” the notice read. “Features that require sign-in like most games, apps and social activity won’t be available.”
Article Summary: Microsoft has fixed the Xbox Live service outage that impacted users worldwide. According to the official support page of Xbox, the service is now up and running. The outage, according to Downdetector, started late night on July 2 around 11pm IST.

Article Title: Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max may offer longer battery life
Article Text:
Apple to use steel battery case to tackle overheating

Apple iPhone 16 series rumours

Apple iPhone 16 series is expected to launch in September and in the run up to the debut, the rumour mill is already churning out scores of leaks. According to another such leak, iPhone 16 Pro Max is expected to get a boost in battery life .Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo has said that the Cupertino-based giant is increasing the energy density of the battery cells of iPhone 16 Pro Max, which will result in longer battery life.“My latest supply chain survey indicates the energy density (Wh/kg) of the battery cells of iPhone 16 Pro Max will increase, which has the benefit of longer battery life with the same battery size or lower battery size with the same battery life,” he said in a post.However, with increase in energy density of the battery cells, there will be an increase in temperature when running. To tackle this, Apple will use the stainless steel battery case .“Increasing the energy density of the battery cells will increase the battery temperature when running. To avoid overheating the battery, Apple uses the stainless steel battery case for the first time as a thermal solution ,” Kuo said.While stainless steel may not be as effective as aluminium in dissipating heat, “it is more robust and less susceptible to corrosion, so in addition to dissipating heat, the stainless steel battery case provides better protection for the battery and the iPhone system.”Kuo noted that the use of a stainless steel battery case will reduce the difficulty of removing the battery, hence, helping Apple to “comply with the European Union’s requirements for mobile phone batteries’ replaceability in the future.”“If the mass production of this new battery design (upgraded energy density of battery cells & adoption of the stainless steel battery case) goes well and the feedback is favourable, this new battery design will be adopted in all 2H25 new iPhone models,” Kuo noted.The iPhone 16 series is rumoured to replace physical buttons with touch-sensitive buttons that simulate a press with haptic feedback. The camera layout might shift to a vertical design, unlike the current diagonal setup. The customisable Action button, currently on Pro models, might be available on all iPhone 16 models.Under the hood, the standard iPhone 16 and Plus models might use the A18 chip , while Pro models could get the A18 Pro chip. Meanwhile, the display size for iPhone 16 and Plus (6.1-inch and 6.7-inch) might remain the same, but the refresh rate could improve.
Article Summary: iPhone 16 Pro Max is expected to get a boost in battery life. Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo said that the Cupertino-based giant is increasing the energy density of the battery cells. With increase in energy density, there will be an increase in temperature when running. To tackle this, Apple will use the stainless steel battery case.

Article Title: Former N.CUS' member Soon aka Nam Seung Hyun shocks fans with girlfriend announcement
Article Text: Nam Seung Hyun , formerly known as Soon from the boy group N.CUS and a contestant on 'My Teenage Boy: Fantasy Boys ', recently set off a wave of reactions among fans, particularly in Japan, by publicly acknowledging his relationship. The stir began on July 4 when eagle-eyed netizens discovered Soon's social media posts featuring his girlfriend, complete with shared photos and matching Instagram bios.The revelation quickly went viral, garnering over 2 million views and sparking varied responses from fans.Many expressed disappointment and frustration, feeling blindsided by the sudden disclosure on a platform they closely follow. Comments ranged from critiques like "It's gross to do this on an account your fans follow," to questions about his previous commitments and promises.In response to the uproar, Nam Seung Hyun issued a public statement addressing the situation. He clarified that during his time on 'Fantasy Boys', he was single and focused solely on his idol aspirations. After parting ways with his agency, he met his girlfriend, and they are now contemplating marriage. He expressed regret for not disclosing this earlier and acknowledged the impact of his actions on fans who supported him through his idol journey."Hello, this is Nam Seung Hyun. I apologize for causing concern to the fans regarding the current controversy. I would like to address the situation and the misunderstandings. Firstly, during the filming of 'Fantasy Boys', I did not have a girlfriend. I was genuinely dedicated to the program, dreaming of becoming an idol again. I worked hard, motivated by the love and support from the fans, and I tried to reciprocate that love.Currently, my contract with the agency has ended. I am now a regular person who no longer dreams of becoming an idol. I met my girlfriend after the program ended, and we are seriously discussing marriage. I hope you can refrain from making excessive speculations about my girlfriend, who is a regular person like myself.As a trainee, I thought it was necessary to inform the fans that my contract with the agency had ended and that I was no longer pursuing the dream of becoming an idol. I believed it was a responsible situation. Due to my mistake of not mentioning my girlfriend, it has led to the current situation. I apologize for the disappointment. Thank you for your support until now. Your support helped me endure tough times."This statement aimed to clear the air and set the record straight, emphasizing his gratitude to fans while acknowledging the need for better communication moving forward.
Article Summary: Nam Seung Hyun, formerly known as Soon from the boy group N.CUS, set off a wave of reactions among fans, particularly in Japan. The stir began on July 4 when eagle-eyed netizens discovered Soon's social media posts featuring his girlfriend, complete with shared photos and matching Instagram bios.
